greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangular array, read by rows: second differences in n,n direction of trinomial array A027907.
comment: For n > 2, T(n,k) is the number of integer strings s(0), ..., s(n) such that s(n) = n - k, s(0) = 0, |s(i) - s(i-1)| = 1 for i = 1,2 and <= 1 for i >= 3.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1874 [a(676) ff. corrected by _Georg Fischer_, Jun 24 2020]
formula: G.f.: y*z + (1-y*z)^2 / (1-z*(1+y+y^2)). - _Ralf Stephan_, Jan 09 2005 [corrected by _Peter Luschny_, Jun 25 2020]
maple: if n < 0 or k < 0 or k > 2*n then
seq(seq(A024996(n,k), k=0..2*n), n=0..11); # added by _Georg Fischer_, Jun 24 2020
mathematica: nmax = 10; CoefficientList[CoefficientList[Series[y*x + (1 - y*x)^2/(1 - x*(1 + y + y^2)), {x, 0, nmax}, {y, 0, 2*nmax}], x], y] // Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 22 2017; amended by _Georg Fischer_, Jun 24 2020 *)
program: nmax=8; for(n=0, nmax, for(k=0, 2*n, print1(T(n,k),","))) \\ added by __Georg Fischer_, Jun 24 2020
ser = divexact(x^2*t^3 + x^2*t + x*t - 1, x*t^2 + x*t + x - 1)
xref: First differences in n, n direction of array A025177.
Central column is essentially A024997, other columns are A024998, A026069, A026070, A026071. Row sums are in A025579.
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_
ext: Offset corrected by _R. J. Mathar_, Jun 23 2013
